item.title: Susan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I feel thin, sort of stretched, like butter scraped over too much bread." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Susan add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Susan add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "When the Day of Judgment dawns and people, great and small, come marching in to receive their heavenly rewards, the Almighty will gaze upon the mere bookworms and say to Peter, â€œLook, these need no reward. We have nothing to give them. They have loved reading." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Susan add a quote by William F. Buckley
item.description: "Liberals claim to want to give a hearing to other views, but then are shocked and offended to discover that there are other views." -- William F. Buckley

item.title: Susan add a quote by Barry Goldwater
item.description: "A government big enough to give you everything you want is big enough to take everything you have." -- Barry Goldwater

item.title: Susan add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Susan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Susan add a quote by Betty Friedan
item.description: "No woman gets an orgasm from shining the kitchen floor. " -- Betty Friedan

item.title: Susan add a quote by Laurence J. Peter
item.description: "Before publishers' blurbs were invented, authors had to make their reputations by writing." -- Laurence J. Peter
